concept.title: File Tail
concept.shortdesc: The File Tail origin reads data as it is written to an active file after reading related archived files in the same directory.

conbody.p: File Tail originovervieworiginsFile TailWhen you configure File Tail, you define the active file name, the naming convention for archived files, and the first archived file to process. These properties determine the files that File Tail processes.

When the pipeline stops, File Tail notes where it stops reading. When the pipeline starts again, File Tail continues processing from where it left off by default. You can reset the origin to process all requested files before continuing to the active file.

You can use File Tail to read related sets of files in multiple directories. Each directory can include a single active file. When File Tail processes files in multiple directories, it merges all data in the pipeline. add that it's line by line
